summary: The World Customs Organisation (WCO) is a pivotal entity in global customs governance, striving to enhance cooperation among its members. It examines matters related to customs regulations, facilitating the negotiation of conventions that promote unity and efficiency in international trade. The WCO's status as a world organisation allows it to represent the interests of its members during exploratory talks on customs obligations. The EU, as a member, actively participates in sessions to adopt amendments that align with its regulatory framework. Through this cooperation, the WCO supports the adoption of best practices, enabling members to maintain compliance and enhance their customs competence.
